Ukiyo: A Haven for Language Learners

Don't know where to start, how to learn or can't find friends.

Join Now! Get started
Art by Manu

Kenzo: AI Chat Bot

Your AI Learning Assistant. Interact with Kenzo for study reminders, to-do lists, and friendly language practice.

Exclusive Resource Repository

A members-only library of exclusive language learning materials not found anywhere else.

Language Partner Matching

Pairs up with members for language exchange, and practice with native speakers.

Virtual Study Groups

Collaborate and Learn Together. Join peer-led study sessions to boost your language skills alongside fellow learners.

Daily Dose of Culture

Immerse yourself with our 'Daily Dose of Culture' feature, providing you with snippets of cultural insights, everyday expressions, and etiquette tips.

Word of the Day

Daily Linguistic Gems. Discover and master a new word every day to steadily output your vocabulary.

" Joining Ukiyo has been a game-changer for my Japanese studies. I've always been a fan of anime and wanted to understand it without subtitles. The resources and the community here are so welcoming and helpful, it feels like I'm part of a cool club. Plus, chatting with Kenzo has made learning new words super fun and easy to remember! "

Emma

High School Student

" As someone with a busy schedule, finding time for language learning was a challenge. Ukiyo's flexible study groups and the resource library have been invaluable. It's like having a personal language coach! I can engage with the material on my commute or during lunch breaks. The progress I've made is incredible, and the friendly competition on the leaderboard keeps me motivated. "

Alex

Software Developer

" Ukiyo isn't just a study server; it's a vibrant community that celebrates every small victory on your language journey. The daily cultural insights add an exciting layer to my routine practice, and the events are always the highlight of my week. It's the perfect blend of learning and fun! "

Sam

University Student

Frequently
asked questions

Answers to the most frequently asked questions.

You can start by joining Ukiyo's Discord server or our starter guide. We have a provided all the resources you need to get started with Japanese. First you need to learn Hiragana and Katakana. Then you can start learning Kanji and grammar. While doing so you can start practicing your listening skills by watching Japanese media. We have a list of recommended resources for each of these steps.

We provide books, flashcards, and practice tests for each JLPT level. We also have a audo and video resources for listening practice. You can find all of these resources in our library page.

Yes, in Ukiyo Server you can track your study time by using Leo Bot. You can join any VC channel under "STUDY VCS" and Leo will track it. And you will be will be able to use our Pomodoro Timer to track your study time once it is released.

By joining Ukiyo, you gain access to a supportive community of language learners, diverse resources for studying Japanese and English, and tools that can track and enhance your study sessions. Plus, our friendly atmosphere makes learning a new language fun and engaging.

Our Word of the Day channel introduces a new vocabulary word daily, complete with its meaning, pronunciation, and an example sentence. It's a simple, effective way to enrich your vocabulary regularly.

Absolutely! Kenzo is an AI-powered chatbot that offers study tips, tracks your learning progress, and can even participate in basic conversations to help you practice your language skills.
